Articles.Content:
Hello all kerbonauts!

I'm Dominique, 52 yrs old french guy, living at Chartres, 100 km west of Paris, this city is known about its wonderful cathedral!

I've bought Kerbal Space Program during september 2013 (09/11, really a fateful date), from KSP Store (less expensive, $US 23.00). I've used it a few bit, but more intensive play since November 11, 2013 (v1.0.5.1028) playing every afternoon (I've a lot of time to waste because I'm unemployed), after a new/fresh install on my PC. I'm newbie here (I've joined this forum yesterday). Other favorite games are Flight Simulator X, pinball simulations (Future Pinball, The Pinball Arcade) and infiltration games (Splinter Cell series).

Favorite addons for KSP are MechJeb2, KER, Kerbal Alarm Clock and, for docking, DPAI. No problem with these addons. I'll plan to try KIS, seems to be an interessing addon too!

I've started a career mode (normal difficulty) - in parallel with sandox (for launcher validations), for now, I've (only) reached Duna orbit and Ike landing... but wanting more science points to unlock ion technology.

Hope we can exchange ideas, help or something here!

Greetings from France.

Dominique
Welcome to the forum, DomiKamu. Nice to have you here.

Hello DomiKamu, and welcome to the forum!

Sounds like you're well into the game.  Around here we often exchange ideas, help, pictures, strategies, techniques, facts, equations, jokes, and many other things.  Glad to have you aboard.

Happy landings!

Bienvenue, Dominique! I was just in Chartes a few months ago, perhaps we saw each other and didn't realize it? Of course I usually wear a cavalry hat just like in my avatar, but I would have had to take it off inside the cathedral so you would not have recognized me Anyway glad to have you aboard. Well done on your Duna exploration, now other worlds await you!

Wow, two years in. Glad to see you join the forums.

Welcome, and I hope you manage to find a few comfortable corners of the forum. It's a new home for all of us (just migrated), but seems to be coming along.

 

Have fun, and keep pushing those kerbals!
Hi, @crystalfisk282! it's good to have you here. If you have any gameplay questions, you might want to check out the "Gameplay Questions" subforum.
